history.content:
My recommendation is for you to take CS 70 in the Spring. If you make it after Spring, you're golden.  If you don't make it, then take CS 61B.

I was in the same situation and did exactly the same thing, though I did declare after CS70 so I didn't have to go into the following semester taking CS 61B.

(As it turned out, I declared and wound up re-taking CS 61B anyhow because that's what everyone recommends....but since I'm declared, I don't have to worry about getting a particular grade anymore as long as it's a passing grade).

-----

As someone who took 70 over the summer, I can't really say that 70 is necessarily easier taking it that way. A lot of people took it that way and then dropped because over the summer you have a late drop that is independent of the late drop you get for the semesters (about 1/6 ish of my class dropped late before the final). The thing about the class is that they attempt to teach you A LOT and over the summer this is done in 2x the speed, so you have less time in general to just soak in the material. I took it with an R&C course and I felt really burned out by the end. I think if you only took 70 over the summer, and literally nothing else/didn't work, etc., you'd probably find it easier. But it may just be easier to take 70 in the spring with two other non-crucial classes.

My recommendation is for you to take CS 70 in the Spring. If you make it after Spring, you're golden.  If you don't make it, then take CS 61B.

I was in the same situation and did exactly the same thing, though I did declare after CS70 so I didn't have to go into the following semester taking CS 61B.

(As it turned out, I declared and wound up re-taking CS 61B anyhow because that's what everyone recommends....but since I'm declared, I don't have to worry about getting a particular grade anymore as long as it's a passing grade).

Hi, I'm a junior transfer majoring in L&S Comp Sci and I still need to declare. I've taken 61A, and my coursework from community college exempts me from having to take 61B. However, I'm worried about meeting the 3.3 GPA cutoff, particularly because of CS 70, so I'm thinking about taking CS 61B anyways to help boost my GPA. I'm debating whether to take 61B in Spring 20 and CS 70 in Summer 20. I've heard CS 70 over the summer is "easier" than taking it over a whole semester. Does this seem like a good plan? And do you guys really think its "easier" to take CS 70 over the Summer? I have no prior experience in discrete.
history.subject: Spring 20 Schedule Advice
